alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 04 at 3:34AM MST until March 05 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MST ACROSS THE WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, SANDIA/MANZANO AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN PLAINS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY.. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .An upper level disturbance will bring strong southwest winds aloft into New Mexico today. Through the afternoon, these strong winds will mix down to the surface with gusty conditions expected over much of southwestern, central, and eastern New Mexico. In addition, above average warmth will remain in place with dry conditions, low humidity, and an unstable atmosphere. This will lead to several hours of critical fire weather. Strong winds and low humidity are expected to redevelop and align over the eastern plains of New Mexico Saturday afternoon where critical fire weather conditions will one again threaten. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SATURDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect Saturday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast and East Central Plains of New Mexico from 11 AM this morning through 8 PM MST this evening. Critical fire weather conditions could redevelop again Saturday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest at 20 to 35 mph with occasional gusts of 40 to 50 mph today. On Saturday, winds will turn more from the west with sustained speeds of 20 to 35 mph and occasional gusts to 40 to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping between 11 to 15 percent late this afternoon and again Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning for today. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch for Saturday.
